00078 class DODSFilter {
00079 protected:
00080     bool d_comp;        // True if the output should be compressed.
00081     bool d_ver;         // True if the caller wants version info.
00082     bool d_bad_options;     // True if the options (argc,argv) are bad.
00083     bool d_conditional_request;
00084 
00085     string d_program_name;  // Name of the filter program
00086     string d_dataset;       // Name of the dataset/database 
00087     string d_ce;        // Constraint expression 
00088     string d_cgi_ver;       // Version of CGI script (caller)
00089     string d_anc_dir;       // Look here for ancillary files
00090     string d_anc_file;      // Use this for ancillary file name
00091     string d_cache_dir;     // Use this for cache files
00092 
00093     int d_timeout;      // Server timeout after N seconds
00094 
00095     time_t d_anc_das_lmt;   // Last modified time of the anc. DAS.
00096     time_t d_anc_dds_lmt;   // Last modified time of the anc. DDS.
00097     time_t d_if_modified_since; // Time from a conditional request.
00098 
00099     DODSFilter() {}     // Private default ctor.
00100 
00101     void initialize(int argc, char *argv[]);
00102 
00103     virtual int process_options(int argc, char *argv[]);
00104 
00105 public:
00106     DODSFilter(int argc, char *argv[]);
00107 
00108     virtual ~DODSFilter();
00109 
00116     bool OK() { return !d_bad_options; }
00117 
00130     bool version() { return d_ver; }
00131 
00132     bool is_conditional();
00133 
00134     string get_cgi_version();
00135 
00136     void set_cgi_version(string version);
00137 
00138     string get_ce();
00139 
00140     void set_ce(string _ce);
00141 
00142     string get_dataset_name();
00143 
00144     virtual void set_dataset_name(const string _dataset);
00145 
00146     virtual string get_dataset_version();
00147 
00148     virtual time_t get_dataset_last_modified_time();
00149 
00150     virtual time_t get_das_last_modified_time(const string &anc_location="");
00151 
00152     virtual time_t get_dds_last_modified_time(const string &anc_location="");
00153 
00154     virtual time_t get_data_last_modified_time(const string &anc_location="");
00155 
00156     virtual time_t get_request_if_modified_since();
00157 
00158     virtual string get_cache_dir();
00159 
00160     void set_timeout(int timeout = 0);
00161 
00162     int get_timeout() const;
00163 
00164     virtual void establish_timeout(FILE *stream);
00165 
00166     virtual void read_ancillary_das(DAS &das, string anc_location = "");
00167 
00168     virtual void read_ancillary_dds(DDS &dds, string anc_location = "");
00169 
00170     virtual void print_usage();
00171 
00172     virtual void send_version_info();
00173 
00174     virtual void send_das(DAS &das, const string &anc_location = "");
00175     virtual void send_das(ostream &os, DAS &das,
00176               const string &anc_location="");
00177     virtual void send_das(FILE *out, DAS &das,
00178               const string &anc_location="");
00179 
00180     virtual void send_dds(DDS &dds, bool constrained = false,
00181               const string &anc_location = "");
00182     virtual void send_dds(ostream &os, DDS &dds, bool constrained = false,
00183               const string &anc_location = "");
00184     virtual void send_dds(FILE *out, DDS &dds, bool constrained = false,
00185               const string &anc_location = "");
00186 
00187     virtual void functional_constraint(BaseType &var, DDS &dds, FILE *out, 
00188                        time_t lmt) throw(Error);
00189     virtual void dataset_constraint(DDS &dds, FILE *out, time_t lmt) 
00190     throw(Error);
00191 
00192     virtual void send_data(DDS &dds, FILE *data_stream,
00193                const string &anc_location = "");
00194 };

00196 // Revision 1.4  2004/02/05 06:51:16  jimg
00196 // Added/update.
00196 //
00197 // Revision 1.26.2.3  2003/07/25 06:04:28  jimg
00198 // Refactored the code so that DDS:send() is now incorporated into
00199 // DODSFilter::send_data(). The old DDS::send() is still there but is
00200 // depracated.
00201 // Added 'smart timeouts' to all the variable classes. This means that
00202 // the new server timeouts are active only for the data read and CE
00203 // evaluation. This went inthe BaseType::serialize() methods because it
00204 // needed to time both the read() calls and the dds::eval() calls.
00205 //
00206 // Revision 1.26.2.2  2003/07/23 23:56:36  jimg
00207 // Now supports a simple timeout system.
00208 //
00209 // Revision 1.26.2.1  2003/06/23 11:49:18  rmorris
00210 // The #pragma interface directive to GCC makes the dynamic typing
00211 // functionality go completely haywire under OS X on the PowerPC. We can't
00212 // use that directive on that platform and it was ifdef'd out for that case.
00213 //

00245 // Revision 1.18.2.4  2001/08/21 14:54:43  dan
00246 // Added a set_dataset_name method to provide a mechanism to change the
00247 // dataset name in the DODSFilter class, which currently can only be set
00248 // by running the constructor.   This method was required for a modification
00249 // to the jg-dods server which now support relative pathnames as part of
00250 // the object name.
00251 //
00252 // Revision 1.19  2001/06/15 23:49:02  jimg
00253 // Merged with release-3-2-4.
00254 //
00255 // Revision 1.18.2.3  2001/06/14 21:32:04  jimg
00256 // Added a method to set the cgi_version property without relying on the ctor.
00257 //
00258 // Revision 1.18.2.2  2001/05/03 19:10:35  jimg
00259 // Added the d_conditional_request and d_if_modified_since fields. These are
00260 // used to indicate that the request from the client is a conditional GET
00261 // request. DODS currently only supports conditional requests based on the Last
00262 // Modified time included by a server in a response. The ctor takes a -l switch
00263 // which expects the time given with the If-Modified-Since header. This provides
00264 // an easy way for servers to handle the conditional request since they can
00265 // simply pass the switches and parameters they receive directly to DODSFilter
00266 // (as if they were opaque objects).
00267 //
00268 // Revision 1.18.2.1  2001/04/23 22:34:46  jimg
00269 // Added support for the Last-Modified MIME header in server responses.`
00270 //
00271 // Revision 1.18  2000/10/30 17:21:27  jimg
00272 // Added support for proxy servers (from cjm).
00273 //
00274 // Revision 1.17  2000/09/22 02:17:19  jimg
00275 // Rearranged source files so that the CVS logs appear at the end rather than
00276 // the start. Also made the ifdef guard symbols use the same naming scheme and
00277 // wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00278 // down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00279 //
00280 // Revision 1.16  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00281 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00282 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00283 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00284 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00285 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00286 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00287 //

00290 // for differences between the Standard C++ Library - most notably, the
00291 // iostream's.
